project.teaser: Urgent accelerated action is required to adapt to unavoidable and ongoing climate change. Climate-resilient investments must be substantially scaled up. Public budgets will not be able to address the adaptation financing challenge alone, financing from the private sector will...
project.objective: Urgent accelerated action is required to adapt to unavoidable and ongoing climate change. Climate-resilient investments must be substantially scaled up. Public budgets will not be able to address the adaptation financing challenge alone, financing from the private sector will also be necessary. CLIMATEFIT contributes to bridging the resilience financing gap by providing critical insight and building the capacities of Public Authorities (PAs) to attract and orchestrate various public and private funding & financing sources, and of Financing and Investment Entities (FIEs) to discover and access resilient investment opportunities. CLIMATEFIT will experiment on a mix of 20 territories in Southern, Eastern and Northwestern Europe in their transformational pathways towards climate resilience. The journey will start by taking stock of funding & financing barriers and enablers gathered in the Financing Landscape taxonomy. CLIMATEFIT will create an ingenious Manual for leveraging finance to, 1) co-design 20 innovative investment strategies allowing to identify sources of funding 2) develop 10 credible and scalable investment plans to help better negotiate and articulate financing streams and define investment concepts, and 3) pilot 4 bankable, tailored investment cases. CLIMATEFIT will build a Pathway for FIEs to accelerate finance, test refined methods to reward climate-resilient investment and apply smart adaptation funding and financing solutions. It will establish Local Resilience Taskforces (LRTs) composed of PAs and FIEs that propose a catalytic and systemic approach to resilience financing. Led by WCF, the high-level consortium will build capacity, co-create solutions with PAs and FIEs, and inform EU adaptation and sustainable finance policies. Finally, CLIMATEFIT aims to boost resilience financing in Europe by consolidating the dynamics in LRTs, and to promote and scale its research findings through the European Network of LRTs and its user-oriented One-Stop Shop.
project.title: Resilient CLIMATE Financing and Investment Taskforces
project.keywords: climate resilience, financing, investments, funding, public authorities

article.title: Bridging the climate resilience financing gap

result.title: Scoping study for the Project’s CLIMATEFIT website /One Stop Shop and e-learning platform
result.description: Scoping study for the Projects CLIMATEFIT website /One Stop Shop and e-learning platform.

result.title: Draft white paper for policymakers and practitioners
result.description: Provides recommendations to support the mainstreaming of climate resilience finance

result.title: Data Management Plan first draft
result.description: Ensures that the data collected all along the project comply with the FAIR data principles

result.title: Taskforce of Innovation Management (TIM)
result.description: Taskforce of Innovation Management (TIM) set up in WP1 at the commencement of the Project lead by UA with partners to take carriage of the E&UP and the materialization through innovation of the project impacts.

result.title: Adaptation Investment Landscape
result.description: Provides an investment landscape of approaches developed by supply and demand and map the sources, actors and possible Investment Concepts and AFFS for the 20 case studies, their FIEs and international good practices

result.title: Communication and Dissemination Plan first draft
result.description: Communication and Dissemination Plan (C&DP) and update to lay out a consistent and effective branding, targets messaging and defines the appropriate communication and dissemination channels and activities. Linked to the C&DP an Exploitation and Upscale plan (E&UP) elaborating on how to link up to and create partnerships with existing initiatives is added in WPI.2 (WCF and partners) Taskforce of Innovation Management (TIM) at the commencement of the Project in WP1 lead by UA with partners

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - CLIMATEFIT (Resilient CLIMATE Financing and Investment Taskforces)
result.teaser: Climate adaptation investments must be substantially scaled up. Public budgets will not be able to address the adaptation financing challenge alone, financing from the private sector will also be necessary. CLIMATEFIT contributes to bridging the adaptation finance gap by...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
